title: Deals for Today: Our Favorite Gaming Headset Is Discounted to Its Lowest Price Ever as Memorial Day Sales Continue
description: The Memorial Day sales are in full swing, so you can enjoy deep discounts on just about everything. Gaming headsets, wireless chargers, TVs, portable speakers, grills, and mattresses are all on sale for the holiday weekend.
author: Danielle Abraham
excerpt: The Memorial Day sales are in full swing, so you can enjoy deep discounts on just about everything. Gaming headsets, wireless chargers, TVs, portable speakers, grills, and mattresses are all on sale for the holiday weekend.
text: The Memorial Day deals continue throughout this holiday weekend, delivering some of the deepest discounts of the year on a range of products. I’m particularly stoked to see that our favorite gaming headset, the SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless, is down to its lowest price ever. But if you’re after something a little more budget-friendly, the JBL Quantum 200 gaming headset is 50% off. After you’ve settled on a headset, now is also a great time to grab a gaming chair and desk to amp up your battle station, as Secretlab has an awesome Memorial Day sale. TL;DR: Deals for TodayThere are plenty of other items discounted right now. Whether you want to get your backyard in tip-top shape with a new grill and a leaf blower, or are looking to score cheap video games and Blu-rays for rainy day entertainment, there’s a deal for you. Check them out below: Twelve South MagSafe Charging StandTwelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe Wireless MagSafe Charging StandThe Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe Wireless MagSafe Charging Stand is a one-stop shop to top up all your Apple gadgets, and it’s at its lowest price ever during Amazon’s Memorial Day sale. This space-saving, well-designed charging station features an adjustable 15W MagSafe charger for an iPhone that doubles as a tiltable stand, along with a 5W Apple Watch charger and another 7.5W Qi Wireless charger for wireless earbuds or another phone. Best of all, only one cord is required to charge all these devices, and it even comes with international plug adapters for your upcoming overseas trips. JBL Quantum 200JBL Quantum 200The JBL Quantum 200 is a great budget gaming headset with a starting price of just $60, and a limited-time deal cuts that number in half. This over-ear offering is comfortable on head with a lightweight build and plush earcups. The 50mm drivers pump out a realistic soundstage, putting you at the center of the action, while the boom mic does a decent job of focusing on your voice. Since the headset is wired, its 3.5mm jack makes for nearly universal compatibility, letting you play on any platform. SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro WirelessSteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro WirelessWhile the JBL Quantum 200 may be budget-friendly, our top gaming headset of 2025 has dropped to its lowest price ever. Both the PlayStation and Xbox versions of the SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless are under $230, delivering unbelievable sound quality, a clear mic, and an extremely comfortable fit. But what makes this headset a true standout is its battery system and base station. You’ll never be without a charge using this wireless headset, thanks to the two included hot-swappable batteries. Plus, the base station makes adjusting volume, turning on active noise cancellation, and more a breeze. Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10With many a window sure to be left open in the warm months ahead, an excellent air purifier is a good way to keep pollutants from filling your home and turning into an allergen nightmare. To keep the air fresh, the Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10 is discounted by 30% to $299.95 – just one dollar more than its lowest price ever. This Air purifier and fan combo oscillates 350° and features a fully sealed HEPA H13 filter, pumping clean air out without using blades while trapping 99.97% of particles as small as 0.3 microns. When you want to turn it off, on, or adjust the settings, a handy remote control lets you control it from across the room. A night mode also makes this already quiet fan even quieter for a restful sleep. Plus, it’s a Dyson, so you know the longevity of this machine, making for a sound investmentSecretlab Titan EvoSecretlab Titan EvoEnjoy up to $139 off gaming chairs, desks, and more during Secretlab’s Memorial Day sale. The Titan Evo, which held the top spot on our best gaming chair guide for years (only to be dethroned by the Titan Evo Nanogen), is part of the deal, dropping the seat’s price by 22%. There are plenty of reasons to love this chair; the build quality is impeccable, the ergonomics are next level, and the unique design features add even more comfort. If you’ve been waiting to buy a gaming chair, now is a great time to invest. Below are some other great deals from Secretlab taking place throughout the Memorial Day weekend. LEAPUL 21V Cordless Electric Leaf Blower LEAPUL 21V Cordless Electric Leaf Blower Summer is here, and so is the yard work. A leaf blower is the perfect addition to your lawn care tools, and an electric option is on sale for its lowest price right now. With up to 420 CFM, this leaf blower can easily clean leaves, lawn clippings, and debris from decks, patios, and driveways without a power cord or gas. Weighing only four pounds, it’s easy to handle one-handed, while the two 21V-2.0Ah, fast-charging batteries should deliver about 20 minutes of power – plenty of time to clean up smaller yards. That’s not too shabby for a leaf blower that will only set you back $65.99. F.W. Murnau's Nosferatu Blu-rayNosferatu Blu-rayGrab this remastered Blu-ray of the classic, unauthorized Bram Stoker Dracula vampire tale originally filmed over 100 years ago. Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau-Stiftung did the 35mm restoration, creating this stunning HD edition. It even features the orchestral performance of Hans Erdmann's 1922 score, remaining faithful to the original film. If you’re after skin-crawling horror, you can grab F.W. Murnau's Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror for 50% off, making it just 19.99. A bonus 52-minute documentary is included, adding more value to the package. Fitbit Versa 4Fitbit Versa 4Stay on track of your health and fitness goals by grabbing one of our favorite Android smartwatches, the Fitbit Versa 4. It’s discounted by $50 for Memorial Day weekend, making it just $150. Plenty of smarts are baked into this watch, from all the health monitoring and fitness tracking you could need to a GPS and contactless payments. Plus, its six-day battery life puts the Apple Watch to shame.Blink Outdoor 4Blink Outdoor 4Adding a few security cameras to your home is never a bad idea. Whether you want to keep porch pirates at bay or check on your pup at work, these gadgets can be super useful. Right now, Blink has a great deal on the Blink Outdoor 4 with a 3-pack of wireless cameras costing just 129.99 – the lowest price we’ve seen this year. These cameras are capable of capturing 1080p HD live view and have infrared night vision for 24/7 monitoring. Motion sensing can deliver alerts right to your smartphone, while the 2-year battery life means you’ll rarely need to worry about swapping the AA batteries.2025 Apple iPad (A16)Apple iPad (A16) 128GBThe new iPad is back down to its lowest price ever. Apple released the latest 11-inch iPad in March, and $50 has already been knocked off the price tag for the holiday weekend. The newest model got a few upgrades over its predecessor. Most notably, the tablet now runs on an A16 processor for a snappy experience performing everyday tasks, and base storage has been doubled to 128 GB. But even with these improvements, Apple didn’t increase the starting price from the 10th-generation iPad, making it just $349 to start. While the classic iPad is the best iPad for most people, many of Apple’s other latest tablets have similar discounts for the holiday weekend. Our favorite iPad for students, the iPad Air (M3), which also came out in March, has up to $100 off, while the latest iPad mini has a similar deal, making it 20% off. Sonos Move 2Sonos Move 2Sonos is synonymous with creating high-quality, great-sounding speakers, and one of its portable Bluetooth offerings, the Move 2, is deeply discounted. Enjoy 25% savings on a speaker ready to pump out crystal clear vocals and deep booming bass. Trueplay tuning even allows the speaker to optimize sound to the environment for the best listening experience every time. With a 24-hour battery life and built-in handle, it’s also the perfect option to enjoy your favorite music just about anywhere. Sonos isn’t the only audio giant getting in on the Memorial Day sales. Plenty of other portable speakers are discounted, ensuring you can take your favorite songs on camping trips, picnics, and more. Grill DealsTufons 4-Burner Propane Gas BBQSummer means it’s grilling season, so if your old BBQ is rusted out or broken, now’s the time to buy a new one. Tufons has a high-quality 4-burner grill that is 27% off on Amazon. It will cost just $299.99 for a 457 sq. in cooking area with a total of 46,500 BTU cooking power on the 4 main burners and one side burner. The stainless steel body and cast iron grate are built to last, so this grill should be with you for the long haul. Tufons isn’t the only grill discounted, as plenty of other BBQs are seeing deep discounts for Memorial Day. Everything from charcoal grills and pellet smokers to massive cooktops and portable BBQs are all on sale. LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4The LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4 is at one of its best prices ever today. If you’re looking for an absolutely great gaming TV, this OLED display is impeccable. It offers a stunning 4K picture and up to a 144Hz refresh rate with VRR baked in for butter-smooth action. Right now, you can grab that stunning picture for $1,246.99. That’s over 50% off the list price of the TV when it came out in 2024. Plenty of other TVs are discounted for Memorial Day. Whether you’re after something a little more budget-friendly or want the latest and greatest option, there’s a TV deal to suit your needs. Persona 5 Royal Standard Edition for SwitchPersona 5 Royal Standard Edition for SwitchThe Persona 5 Royal Standard Edition has gotten a serious price cut. It’s down to $25 from $60. Talk about a steal for this epic RPG full of sick locations, captivating stories, and great gameplay mechanics. With the Royal edition comes a new semester at Shujin Academy for more story arcs and even some alternate endings. Be sure to grab this deal while it lasts. Other great Memorial Day game deals are happening right now, including dozens of games on sale for $15 at GameStop. Mattress SalesWhether you need a cheap mattress to plop in a guest room or want a top-end bed for a restful night, there are great Memorial Day mattress sales you don’t want to sleep on. Top brands are offering some of the biggest savings of the year this weekend. Lowe’s marked a bunch of Serta mattresses 25% off, while Casper has its most popular mattresses up to 35% off. Looking to amp up the luxury even further? PlushBeds has knocked $1,500 off the price tag on most beds, and for extra comfort customizations, Sleep Number mattresses are up to half off. Amazon is also taking part, offering a queen-size bed for just $179 along with a whole bunch of other mattress deals. Amplify your comfort even further since accessories like Tempur-Pedic pillows and mattress toppers are also on sale. Nintendo Switch 2 Accessory DealsThe Nintendo Switch 2 release date is under 2 weeks away, and if you’re planning on snagging the new handheld, keeping the pricey device protected should be top priority. Luckily, there are plenty of Switch 2 accessory deals happening this weekend. A few major sales are worth noting, like a JSAUX Protective Case for just $13.99 when you clip a coupon. It wraps the Switch 2 in a shock-absorbing, ergonomic shell for 24/7 protection. When taking the gaming handheld on the go, the over 50% off TZGZT case is a great way to keep it safe and bring along some extra accessories too. Of course, a screen protector is also an absolute must, since a cracked screen is the quickest way to brick the Switch, and a few are on sale today. Originally posted: May 25, 2025 5:15 pm
html:
The Memorial Day deals continue throughout this holiday weekend, delivering some of the deepest discounts of the year on a range of products. I’m particularly stoked to see that our favorite gaming headset, the SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless, is down to its lowest price ever. But if you’re after something a little more budget-friendly, the JBL Quantum 200 gaming headset is 50% off. After you’ve settled on a headset, now is also a great time to grab a gaming chair and desk to amp up your battle station, as Secretlab has an awesome Memorial Day sale.

TL;DR: Deals for Today

There are plenty of other items discounted right now. Whether you want to get your backyard in tip-top shape with a new grill and a leaf blower, or are looking to score cheap video games and Blu-rays for rainy day entertainment, there’s a deal for you. Check them out below:

Twelve South MagSafe Charging Stand

Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe Wireless MagSafe Charging Stand

The Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe Wireless MagSafe Charging Stand is a one-stop shop to top up all your Apple gadgets, and it’s at its lowest price ever during Amazon’s Memorial Day sale. This space-saving, well-designed charging station features an adjustable 15W MagSafe charger for an iPhone that doubles as a tiltable stand, along with a 5W Apple Watch charger and another 7.5W Qi Wireless charger for wireless earbuds or another phone. Best of all, only one cord is required to charge all these devices, and it even comes with international plug adapters for your upcoming overseas trips.

JBL Quantum 200

JBL Quantum 200

The JBL Quantum 200 is a great budget gaming headset with a starting price of just $60, and a limited-time deal cuts that number in half. This over-ear offering is comfortable on head with a lightweight build and plush earcups. The 50mm drivers pump out a realistic soundstage, putting you at the center of the action, while the boom mic does a decent job of focusing on your voice. Since the headset is wired, its 3.5mm jack makes for nearly universal compatibility, letting you play on any platform.

SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless

SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless

While the JBL Quantum 200 may be budget-friendly, our top gaming headset of 2025 has dropped to its lowest price ever. Both the PlayStation and Xbox versions of the SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless are under $230, delivering unbelievable sound quality, a clear mic, and an extremely comfortable fit. But what makes this headset a true standout is its battery system and base station. You’ll never be without a charge using this wireless headset, thanks to the two included hot-swappable batteries. Plus, the base station makes adjusting volume, turning on active noise cancellation, and more a breeze.

Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10

Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10

With many a window sure to be left open in the warm months ahead, an excellent air purifier is a good way to keep pollutants from filling your home and turning into an allergen nightmare. To keep the air fresh, the Dyson Purifier Cool Gen1 TP10 is discounted by 30% to $299.95 – just one dollar more than its lowest price ever.

This Air purifier and fan combo oscillates 350° and features a fully sealed HEPA H13 filter, pumping clean air out without using blades while trapping 99.97% of particles as small as 0.3 microns. When you want to turn it off, on, or adjust the settings, a handy remote control lets you control it from across the room. A night mode also makes this already quiet fan even quieter for a restful sleep. Plus, it’s a Dyson, so you know the longevity of this machine, making for a sound investment

Secretlab Titan Evo

Secretlab Titan Evo

Enjoy up to $139 off gaming chairs, desks, and more during Secretlab’s Memorial Day sale. The Titan Evo, which held the top spot on our best gaming chair guide for years (only to be dethroned by the Titan Evo Nanogen), is part of the deal, dropping the seat’s price by 22%. There are plenty of reasons to love this chair; the build quality is impeccable, the ergonomics are next level, and the unique design features add even more comfort. If you’ve been waiting to buy a gaming chair, now is a great time to invest.

Below are some other great deals from Secretlab taking place throughout the Memorial Day weekend.

LEAPUL 21V Cordless Electric Leaf Blower

LEAPUL 21V Cordless Electric Leaf Blower

Summer is here, and so is the yard work. A leaf blower is the perfect addition to your lawn care tools, and an electric option is on sale for its lowest price right now. With up to 420 CFM, this leaf blower can easily clean leaves, lawn clippings, and debris from decks, patios, and driveways without a power cord or gas. Weighing only four pounds, it’s easy to handle one-handed, while the two 21V-2.0Ah, fast-charging batteries should deliver about 20 minutes of power – plenty of time to clean up smaller yards. That’s not too shabby for a leaf blower that will only set you back $65.99.

F.W. Murnau's Nosferatu Blu-ray

Nosferatu Blu-ray

Grab this remastered Blu-ray of the classic, unauthorized Bram Stoker Dracula vampire tale originally filmed over 100 years ago. Friedrich-Wilhelm-Murnau-Stiftung did the 35mm restoration, creating this stunning HD edition. It even features the orchestral performance of Hans Erdmann's 1922 score, remaining faithful to the original film. If you’re after skin-crawling horror, you can grab F.W. Murnau's Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror for 50% off, making it just 19.99. A bonus 52-minute documentary is included, adding more value to the package.

Fitbit Versa 4

Fitbit Versa 4

Stay on track of your health and fitness goals by grabbing one of our favorite Android smartwatches, the Fitbit Versa 4. It’s discounted by $50 for Memorial Day weekend, making it just $150. Plenty of smarts are baked into this watch, from all the health monitoring and fitness tracking you could need to a GPS and contactless payments. Plus, its six-day battery life puts the Apple Watch to shame.

Blink Outdoor 4

Blink Outdoor 4

Adding a few security cameras to your home is never a bad idea. Whether you want to keep porch pirates at bay or check on your pup at work, these gadgets can be super useful. Right now, Blink has a great deal on the Blink Outdoor 4 with a 3-pack of wireless cameras costing just 129.99 – the lowest price we’ve seen this year. These cameras are capable of capturing 1080p HD live view and have infrared night vision for 24/7 monitoring. Motion sensing can deliver alerts right to your smartphone, while the 2-year battery life means you’ll rarely need to worry about swapping the AA batteries.

2025 Apple iPad (A16)

Apple iPad (A16) 128GB

The new iPad is back down to its lowest price ever. Apple released the latest 11-inch iPad in March, and $50 has already been knocked off the price tag for the holiday weekend. The newest model got a few upgrades over its predecessor. Most notably, the tablet now runs on an A16 processor for a snappy experience performing everyday tasks, and base storage has been doubled to 128 GB. But even with these improvements, Apple didn’t increase the starting price from the 10th-generation iPad, making it just $349 to start.

While the classic iPad is the best iPad for most people, many of Apple’s other latest tablets have similar discounts for the holiday weekend. Our favorite iPad for students, the iPad Air (M3), which also came out in March, has up to $100 off, while the latest iPad mini has a similar deal, making it 20% off.

Sonos Move 2

Sonos Move 2

Sonos is synonymous with creating high-quality, great-sounding speakers, and one of its portable Bluetooth offerings, the Move 2, is deeply discounted. Enjoy 25% savings on a speaker ready to pump out crystal clear vocals and deep booming bass. Trueplay tuning even allows the speaker to optimize sound to the environment for the best listening experience every time. With a 24-hour battery life and built-in handle, it’s also the perfect option to enjoy your favorite music just about anywhere.

Sonos isn’t the only audio giant getting in on the Memorial Day sales. Plenty of other portable speakers are discounted, ensuring you can take your favorite songs on camping trips, picnics, and more.

Grill Deals

Tufons 4-Burner Propane Gas BBQ

Summer means it’s grilling season, so if your old BBQ is rusted out or broken, now’s the time to buy a new one. Tufons has a high-quality 4-burner grill that is 27% off on Amazon. It will cost just $299.99 for a 457 sq. in cooking area with a total of 46,500 BTU cooking power on the 4 main burners and one side burner. The stainless steel body and cast iron grate are built to last, so this grill should be with you for the long haul.

Tufons isn’t the only grill discounted, as plenty of other BBQs are seeing deep discounts for Memorial Day. Everything from charcoal grills and pellet smokers to massive cooktops and portable BBQs are all on sale.

LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4

LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4

The LG 65-Inch OLED evo C4 is at one of its best prices ever today. If you’re looking for an absolutely great gaming TV, this OLED display is impeccable. It offers a stunning 4K picture and up to a 144Hz refresh rate with VRR baked in for butter-smooth action. Right now, you can grab that stunning picture for $1,246.99. That’s over 50% off the list price of the TV when it came out in 2024.

Plenty of other TVs are discounted for Memorial Day. Whether you’re after something a little more budget-friendly or want the latest and greatest option, there’s a TV deal to suit your needs.

Persona 5 Royal Standard Edition for Switch

Persona 5 Royal Standard Edition for Switch

The Persona 5 Royal Standard Edition has gotten a serious price cut. It’s down to $25 from $60. Talk about a steal for this epic RPG full of sick locations, captivating stories, and great gameplay mechanics. With the Royal edition comes a new semester at Shujin Academy for more story arcs and even some alternate endings. Be sure to grab this deal while it lasts.

Other great Memorial Day game deals are happening right now, including dozens of games on sale for $15 at GameStop.

Mattress Sales

Whether you need a cheap mattress to plop in a guest room or want a top-end bed for a restful night, there are great Memorial Day mattress sales you don’t want to sleep on. Top brands are offering some of the biggest savings of the year this weekend. Lowe’s marked a bunch of Serta mattresses 25% off, while Casper has its most popular mattresses up to 35% off. Looking to amp up the luxury even further? PlushBeds has knocked $1,500 off the price tag on most beds, and for extra comfort customizations, Sleep Number mattresses are up to half off.

Amazon is also taking part, offering a queen-size bed for just $179 along with a whole bunch of other mattress deals. Amplify your comfort even further since accessories like Tempur-Pedic pillows and mattress toppers are also on sale.

Nintendo Switch 2 Accessory Deals

The Nintendo Switch 2 release date is under 2 weeks away, and if you’re planning on snagging the new handheld, keeping the pricey device protected should be top priority. Luckily, there are plenty of Switch 2 accessory deals happening this weekend.

A few major sales are worth noting, like a JSAUX Protective Case for just $13.99 when you clip a coupon. It wraps the Switch 2 in a shock-absorbing, ergonomic shell for 24/7 protection. When taking the gaming handheld on the go, the over 50% off TZGZT case is a great way to keep it safe and bring along some extra accessories too. Of course, a screen protector is also an absolute must, since a cracked screen is the quickest way to brick the Switch, and a few are on sale today.

Originally posted: May 25, 2025 5:15 pm
